pr_title: Improve URL resolving logic in ConfigurationFacade

timeline.bodyText:
There's a small concern here.
We should read from file only when it's not tenant url supported mode right.
If it's tenant url supported, context is always a path, that will be resolved to an absolute URL from the URL builder.
If tenant url not supported only we will have to worry about, the context read from the file is absolute or not.
timeline.author: malithie

replies.bodyText:
Even in the tenant qualified mode, we might have a situation where a user has defined a custom path. For example: instead of authenthenticationendpoint/login.do someone could define authenthenticationendpoint/custom_login.do
So when the facade returns in the tenant qualified mode, we can simply return
\t\<tenant_name>\authenthenticationendpoint\custom_login.do
replies.author: mefarazath

replies.bodyText:
I was actually thinking that should be resolved local to the tenant.
But, unlike other endpoints which are defined for the server, there's a case with related to authentication endpoint web app. That is, it allows to be externalized, which can mean server wide there can be an endpoint URL configured, where your above comment applies. Mode of the offering needs to be finalized then
replies.author: malithie

timeline.bodyText:
Should we return the default context here.
Shouldn't that be a absolute public ?
timeline.author: malithie

replies.bodyText: Though of building the absolute public at the consumer level to avoid behaviour change for code that consumes this API in the legacy mode
replies.author: mefarazath

timeline.bodyText: I would prefer if this exception can be thrown and handled at the public API layer
